intro: Hypoestes ecbolioides, commonly known as the "Snowflake" plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bi-colored leaves that often display a mix of white and green. The plant produces small, tubular flowers in shades of purple and pink, typically blooming in spring and summer. It prefers well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular choice for container gardening. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its unique foliage and delicate floral display.
